name: Saffy
short_description:
ShapeJS (http://shapejs.shapeways.com/) provides a method for generating 3D geometry using javascript on top of AbFab3D. However it currently does not give very useful errors.

To allow development of other code to use the wonderful AbFab3D engine without me having to learn Java, this code allows JSON strings to be used as descriptors for 3D geometry. 

Code is provided AS IS and offers no garentee it will work. In fact I would put 
money on there being a mistake in here somewhere.

use with shapeJS with one text arg. Pass it a JSON string and hit run.
Format for JSON object:
{
    "name" : "cross3d",
    "grid" : [-16, 16, -16, 16, -16, 16, 0.1],
    "units" : "MM",
    "data" : [ "union", ["sphere", 0, 0, 0, 5 ],["box", 0, 0, 0, 7, 3, 2] ]
}

Each element of the data consists of an Array with the first element being a 
string that describes the item and then the parameter.


Its called Saffy as it tells its parent software what to do. (ABFab3d)
